text: hi everyone anthony fantano here
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new reason
project new beginnings california rapper
and
tde signee reason who for some reason
still feels like he's in the process of
being rolled out by his label
even though they gave him some prime
real estate on that black panther
soundtrack
back in 2018 his debut dropped that same
year too
and uh to say that the impact of it was
low would be
an understatement but who knows maybe
that project was a fluke
maybe it was a warm up because reason
didn't exactly come into tde
with a whole lot of mixtapes and singles
and
features under his belt to begin with
regardless though he did sign with one
of the most
notable labels in hip-hop right now
pretty much out of the gate so he's got
to have
something for us on this new project
right
i was hoping the bolder cover art this
time around would lead to some
bolder music bolder songs but i only
ended up walking away from this thing
astounded and not in a good way
i don't really see what top dog sees in
this or even
in the need to release this now versus
just you know letting it incubate and
improve it change it build upon it
especially when you have fans who are
fiending for an isaiah rashad project
begging for a sizza project if she waits
any longer to release an album it's
going to be a detriment to her career
but what we have instead is this reason
record and
geez is it forgettable and derivative
for one there's virtually nothing about
reason's voice
his flow or his lyrical style that i
could describe in detail
positively or negatively outside of
maybe noting that some of his
performances on this thing come off
nearly emotionless maybe a little
monotone so
on this project front to back his
wrapping really lacks
any sort of flavor which makes it even
harder to stomach when he is so
obviously copying his top dog
contemporaries
stories i forgot the refrain the beat
the flow
on this thing it all sounds like a store
brand version of kendrick lamar's mad
city
meanwhile reasons very zany and
off-kilter
cracked voice flows and delivery on this
track
is painful to listen to and of course
this track is not the only one loaded
with kendrickisms on this project there
are
knockoff vocal lines or even beats that
sound like they could have
been throwaways from goodkid or even
damn to an extent
whether that be the filtered pianos and
atmospheric synth line
and persistent kicks on fall or even the
chunky boom bap rhythms and woozy
instrumentation on slow
down plus it doesn't really help when
you have all of these distracting
kendrick ad-libs on the song show stop
sort of riding over these trap rhythms
and mystical lead melodies
not only that but reason is consistently
outshined throughout this
project by his features maybe just
listening to him on his own
on the intro or the outro track you
might come away thinking okay
there's certainly potential there but
once he's up against a schoolboy queue
on a track for example
the the gap in the ability to
give a compelling performance is very
obvious
q pretty much makes the song pop
sound like an oxymoron b
side then there's jit out shining even
though it's not one of his best verses
rhapsody uh yeah pretty handily absol
it's no contest the only feature on this
thing that didn't jump out at me was
isaiah rashad
and he didn't sound like his normal self
on the
song extinct he was really out of his
element or at least
underplaying it on purpose this is not
why worry isaiah rashad
so for one track after another new
beginnings just breezes by without much
in the way of aha moments
standout bars sticky refrains or hooks
crazy production
much of the time when reason is actually
leaving an impression on me it's when
he's floundering
whether it be on the opener when he
drops that bar about
being like bed bath and beyond he has a
lot in store
what there's also favorite whose
instrumental positions the track to be a
banger but
over it reason just delivers this
generic stream of
threats and braggadocio and it doesn't
really go much of anywhere especially
when he's going off on this weird
tangent hose wanna me yeah
she can't touch me yeah your ugly
yeah you disgust me yeah
your not my type no no you got
lucky
yeah there are moments on this thing
where he comes off like really
bitter with some old head energy
ranting about how uh people don't listen
to unless it has sex appeal
as if sex appeal in hip-hop or
mainstream music in general is a new
thing you know not only were there video
vixens in the 80s and 90s but the nelly
tiptrill video
is now 20 years old swipe that credit
card through the booty plus at the end
of the day the irony in all of this for
me is that you are literally represented
by one of the biggest
most notable labels in hip-hop which
reputationally
is the antithesis to a lot of these
narratives
if you want to counteract them i guess
the label would just need to release
more music from the key
artists that fans really care about but
then waters there get choppy too
because some of reason's most salient
bars on this project
have to do with labels in the industry
which kind of comes at a head on the
song windows cry the closer
where he's painting this picture of
paranoia and
being left out in the cold by the label
being left with no options were they to
decide to screw him
despite the fact they just allowed you
to drop two projects in two years
and look for sure labels and the
industry at large especially tde
have critiques that are worth leveling
but
reason doesn't exactly come across as
any more knowledgeable on these topics
than any other rapper who is
ranting and raving about this stuff
especially those who have come through
with
really great creative concept albums
about this whole
web of lies and industry traps and so on
and so forth kendrick lamar to pimp a
butterfly thank you so
i don't know i'm at a loss with this one
it's painfully mediocre from front to
back total lack of compelling verses and
performances
forgettable beats really the only thing
that was likable about it
was some of the features and many of
those just
came by way of his connections with tde
so
like like can i really give it to him
for getting some good features on here
from
schoolboy and from absol while i suppose
there's always room for change and
growth
and alteration in one's artistic
trajectory i
can't say i came away from this project
expecting big things from reason
into the future because i just don't
really see what he's bringing to the
table
